intro: Elaphoglossum decoratum, commonly known as the ornate holly fern, is a member of the Dryopteridaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small, evergreen fern that typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories. The plant features finely divided, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive, elegant appearance. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds in clusters called sorus. Elaphoglossum decoratum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in humid, low-light conditions.
